dialogues.text: One thing's for sure. This place ain't no bastard child o Epcott Center. At least, not yet. Sure there's some flash going on, but it's more class than overkill. This is where the pro's come to savor a time forgotten. A joint where every dealer knows your name. Where part of t allure is the smell of moldy paneling and the tactile whi of worn felt. Where "funny business" doesn't just get you blacklisted... It gets you dead. Lets us enter.

dialogues.speaker: CASINO BAR FLOOR
dialogues.text: FOLLOWING BEHIND the figure as he turns out of the slot  corridor and heads over to the bar. He pours himself a cu of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Doris, you got any cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DORIS THE BARTENDER wanders over with a small container. starts to pour... Empty. We quickly STEADICAM AROUND to r BERNIE LOOTZ's features for the first time. His sad sack  eyes register scant surprise at the empty cream container

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just about to leave, when an attractive COCKTAIL WAI cruises up. NATALIE BELISARIO -- late 20's-mid-30's.  Everything about her sparkles, except her eyes. They're post-mortem. She appears frazzled. Sifts through  some coin tips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Shit. (to Doris) Dewars and a Diet Coke. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sheepish look comes over Bernie. He tries to catch her  eye. She doesn't even glance at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. Only the faintest hint of recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Bernie. (to Doris) Hey, you seen Shelly around? He  promised to position me at the tables  tonight. I've been on skid row all  week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chilly) You didn't settle me from last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? You sure? Fuck... And I was way  under. It's been, like, an A.A.  convention the whole week. I'll make  up for it tonight. Promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris mutters something under her breath -- heard that on before -- and dumps Natalie's drinks on her tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I see Shelly, I'll let him know.  That you're looking for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie grabs up her tray. Doesn't even look at Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bitch. That's the third time this  month... (to Bernie) Let me get you that cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring after Natalie) Nah, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get sweet on that, Bernie. Not  unless you're looking to get short- changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She raises the empty cream container for effect, turns it over. A few drops dribble out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie limps away from the bar. We hear another spike of  sound from the gaming area. As he approaches, a FLOORMAN  stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Bernie, Shelly needs you on  eleven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Uh... Let's do the Chivas Regal.  Have that... Natalie bring it over.  The one working nickel slots next to  the Paradise. I spoke to Shelly  earlier, he wants her at the tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The floorman nods, walks off. Bernie makes for the rowdy  gaming tables. Takes his time about it. His approach brin an ill-wind to the area. The players appear to sense it. It's in their reactions. A slight hesitation of the dice. Fingers tensing over a pile of chips. A hand tugging at a tie. The Cooler has arrived. As he reaches table eleven, Natalie intercepts him with a short glass of Chivas Regal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes it from her) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe said I should stick around. You  say something to Shelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie just smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That was fast. Hey, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers up a smile. It jump-starts those dormant eyes. Her whole face comes alive. Notches her up from an eight a ten. Bernie immediately glances away. He's afraid what might read in his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mention it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie gestures her over to table eleven. Immediately mak the HIGH ROLLER in question. A good old boy named BULLDOG He's the one boasting loudly as he shakes the dice with o hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make you a fortune on five and  nine. C'mon forty-five-sixty-three  fifty-four!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie grabs the drink from Natalie's tray, intentionally bumps Bulldog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy, is this your drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, pal. I'm on a roll here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another man gladly accepts the drink. Meanwhile, Bulldog  sends the dice high up into the air. They drop perfectly the table. The stickman calls it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother-fucker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for those bets, folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The croupiers hungrily devour the chips from the table. Bernie moves on quietly before anyone notices. But he's been noticed all right. By Natalie. Not quite su what she's just witnessed. Who is this guy? We hear a VOICE over the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conway, party of twelve, please check  your reservation at the Paradise  Lounge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie reacts immediately to the code words over the spea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Yeah, yeah, I'm comin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A -- a player makes a hard six at a craps table. The play howl... B -- from the same angle we PAN UP from losing dice to th same guy. Bernie looming large in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A -- Bernie taking a seat at another blackjack table. Nex to him, a full table of players on a good run of cards. B -- The same table with less players as the dealer appea to be gaining an edge over the players. The only thing fi up are ashtrays. C -- Same again, with one player. This time with Natalie  watching in the background. Intrigued. QUICK JUMP CUTS sh the player's mountain of chips going down until there is  only one. D -- The dealer taps the felt for the man to bet his last chip. After a moment of indecision he flips the chip into the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the chip becoming an Alka-Seltzer dropping into a glas The glass is in SHELLY KAPLOW's hand. Director of Casino  Operations for the Shangri-la. Late 40's-early 50's. Distinguished, slick, oozing charm. But lose the Cartier, Armani and Paco Raban and you're looking at pure street. He's watching Bernie through the two-way glass. Shakes hi head in admiration. Suddenly the office door swings open. THREE MEN stride in Shelly projects immediate deference to NICKY "FINGERS"  BONNATTO. Mid-50's. Former Geovassi family underboss from "back east." The guy's a relic from the days before MBAs  became the weapon of choice in the "family" business. He  wears his corporate makeover like a bad coat of paint wit traces of Mulberry Street primer showing through. Nicky's accompanied by a pair of CORPORATE TYPES in Hugo  Boss threads. Shelly glances their way with a look that  suggests he's working himself into a full-on sphincter wi up. Bad news x2. Shelly's muscle, LOU stands off to one s with an apologetic expression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky, how the hell are you? I didn't  know you were coming in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky reaches out to shake Shelly's hand. Gets nothing ba then remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) Whassimater? You think I don't wash  up after goin' to the John? Forget  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky grabs Shelly, embraces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncomfortably) You shoulda called ahead. I woulda  sent a car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ehh. We thought we'd surprise you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, anytime, Nicky. Anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly sizes up the corporate types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly, I want you to meet one of  our smartest VPs, Larry Sokolov. And  his numbers guy, Marty Goldfarb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly sees where this is going. Larry extends his hand..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do, Shelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then catches himself. Quickly pulls it back. Shelly st him down for a tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I get you boys to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off their uncomfortable expressions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly seated across from Nicky, Larry and Marty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what brings you to town, Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky looks cautiously across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Shelly, this is your joint,  you run it the way you see fit. But  we got a smart kid here and he's got  some good ideas on how to revitalize  the Shangri-la.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revitalize? What are you talking  about? We did thirty-five million  last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky shoots a look over at Larry and Marty. Larry takes  this as his cue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First off, Shelly, I want you to  know, I have nothing but respect for  you. You've done a fantastic job  with the Shangri-la for the last  sixteen years. No one would dispute  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no one doubts that, Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly nods carefully. But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, the business has changed out  here. You just have to take a look  at the Strip to see what I'm talking  about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, that amusement park mook  fest out there? You know what that  is? That's a fucking violation of  something that used to be beautiful.  That used to have class. Like a  gorgeous high priced hooker with an  exclusive clientele. And then that  Steve Wynn cocksucker knocks her up  and puts her in a family way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky and Larry exchange looks. Marty drops his gaze into his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she's nothing but a cheap, fat  whore hiding behind too much makeup.  I look at her and see all those ugly  stretch marks and I want to cry.  'Cause I remember her as she was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, well... there's no denying the  bottom line. Those eyesores are raking  it in. And we can't compete against  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You think I'm trying to compete  with that? You think this joint's  about bringing in the stroller crowd?  Fresh off some fucking E-ticket ride,  looking to break the house on red  and black. Fremont's never been about  that bullshit. This is where old  time and real money comes to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The numbers, they don't back you up,  Shelly. Nostalgia's grand. We all  love nostalgia -- but it belongs in  a museum. I think it's time to decide  whether you're running a museum or a  casino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly is close to losing it. He catches himself, takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, forget about it. We'll talk  later. Over dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubs his hands  together) So, how's the action?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry shoots him a disapproving look. Off Shelly's distur expression. He's already calculating serious damage contr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie makes his way across the casino floor, when he's  intercepted by Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie. Mr. Cool. Got a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just heading over to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly escorts Bernie over to a nearby bar area. The BART zips over with some drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the knee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie shrugs. Natalie steps up to the bar a few feet awa Puts in a drink order. She catches Bernie's eye. Nods. Bernie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was speaking to this orthopedic  surgeon over at Vegas Memorial. He  tells me they can replace a man's  entire kneecap with titanium. It's  the kinda thing that costs a shitload,  but since the man's into us for five  hundred large, I'm sure we could --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stealing glances at  Natalie) I told you, I'm not gonna be around  after Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Where you gonna go, Bernie? Where  the fuck are you gonna go that's  better'n here? I got you covered in  this town. People, they know you  work for me, that's currency in your  pocket. That's fuckin' respect when  you walk the floor. Where you gonna  get that anyplace else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) Seven days, Shelly. Seven days and  I'm out from under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beautiful WOMAN in a low cut dress, sashays her way pas them, heading for a high rollers craps table. Shelly reac out, napkin in hand, grabs her arm. Hands her his card. S snatches it, looks it over. Immediately loses all attitud Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I like to know who's  shopping it in my neighborhood. You  wanna keep working the Shangri-la,  you come see me tomorrow morning in  my office. We'll go over the rules  together. And before you come, you  bring me a clean bill of health. OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hooker just nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes off. At the same time Natalie leaves with her d order. They walk in the same direction. Shelly mistakes  Bernie's wandering look for interest in the hooker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want that, Bernie? She's yours.  Anytime. I'll keep a tab running for  you. (Bernie shakes his  head) What's a matter? Not your type?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie just stares after Natalie, Shelly finally picking on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are getting hot on fourteen.  I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He limps off. Shelly stares after him. A predator seizing his prey. Calculating.

dialogues.text: One of those center pool style motels. A hard luck oasis, ever there was one. As Bernie limps toward his room, his neighbor, a low rent HOOKER, approaches from the opposite end of the courtyard with a huge-ass JOHN in tow. They converge at their doors at the same time. There's a  weariness about the hooker that's endemic to this town. S winks at Bernie. He nods at her. Then casts a furtive gla over at the John. The man flips him off. The hooker mouth "Sorry." Bernie hastily enters his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie flips on the light. A dim overhead bulb hardly mak a dent in the gloomy surroundings. Typical drab motel  furnishings. We notice a couple of dead plants on the radiator next to the window. A single place setting on the counter. Someth odd: an empty cat food bowl on the kitchenette floor. No  sign of a cat. Go figure. Bernie heads over to the dresser. A half-filled bottle of gin rests next to a lone glass with a crack down the side He pours himself a shot. Turns on the TV. A religious cha Shitty reception.

dialogues.text: an Appalachian Pentecostal service. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Oh yeah, baby, give it to me. Oh  yeah, that's the spot... Do it to me  harder, you big stud... Oooooh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie closes his eyes, tries to ignore the X-rated sound coming at him through the carpaccio thin walls. The hooker's moans are starting to get to him. He raises fist to the wall, then stops himself. He's just not the  confrontational type. Instead, he heads over to the TV, cranks the volume up. T hysterical moaning from the snake ritual now blends in wi the grunting and groaning from next door, making for a bi remix that could only exist in the world of Bernie Lootz. Bernie emits a deep sigh, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big action at the craps tables tonight. The players cheer MR. PINKERTON makes another pass. He exudes USED CAR SALE Natalie arrives with his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven and Seven?

dialogues.text: Pinkerton reaches for the drink without taking his eyes o the table. He throws a hard six. The crowd cheers again. He turns around, stuffs a hundred dollar chip down her sh and slyly cops a feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, dollface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie shudders in disgust. She spins around to leave... runs smack into Bernie, spilling her tray of drinks on hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit... Sorry... I'm such a klutz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie wipes himself off, helps her pick up the pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right. Happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie tries to wipe him down a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, this guy... fuckin' hands,  you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'okay. You might want to stick  around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie wiggles his way next to Pinkerton. He gives the  stickman a certain look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, Mr. Pinkerton. You have  no hard eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (throwing in a chip) Gimmie a hundred dollar hard eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie just watches as Pinkerton throws the dice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight the hard way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players go nuts. The stickman taps the felt in front the shooter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine hundred dollars to Mr. Pinkerton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parlay! Parlay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boxman seated at the center looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon. You can take that action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Boxman feigns concern, then nods in approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm talking about. None  of this low limit bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as the stickman feeds Pinkerton the dice, Bernie fli a dollar chip over toward the center of the table. Natali peers between them to catch a glimpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dollar hard eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chip lands on Pinkerton's parlayed bet. He releases t dice from his stubby little fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight easy! Easy eight! Hard eight  comes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players cry out in defeat. Pinkerton grumbles to hims He fingers his rail of chips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five hundred dollar hard eight. And  press my nine up two units.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws in the chips. The croupier places his bets. The dice are fed back to him. He throws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy way eight! Eight easy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton is fit to be tied. After a passing moment of cl he empties his entire rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire table stops down for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way to go, Pinkie! Bet the farm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton sets his dice carefully and lets them fly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton slams his fist down on the table. He turns to l the table to find Natalie smiling at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck you smiling at, bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinkerton starts to lose it. Security moves in, right on  time. Natalie shoots Bernie a satisfied look. He averts h eyes shyly and limps away. She stares after him for a mom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BUDDY STAFFORD, the Paradise Lounge's star attraction, is performing on stage. He's a poor man's Tony Bennett. Mid late 60's. A staple at the Paradise for the last 20 years The singer sluggishly descends the stage to the lounge fl almost tripping over his microphone cable. Buddy works the room, leaning in real close to the ladies delivering the requisite eye contact. When their companio react with mock outrage, Buddy raises his fists playfully a boxer's defensive stance. It's classic Buddy Stafford  schtick. From somewhere across the lounge, an ATTRACTIVE WOMAN jum up and throws her panties at Buddy. Buddy catches them an waves them in the air... just as another pair whizzes by. We PAN ACROSS to Shelly seated at his corner booth, in th company of Nicky Fingers, Larry and Marty. TIGHT ON SHELLY as he focuses on Buddy. A smile threatens his patented stoicism. He's flashing back on the old days While Nicky and Marty are clearly enjoying Buddy's  performance, Larry fixates on the singer with joyless eye We take on LARRY'S POV of Buddy -- SLOW MOTION CLOSE-UPS of BUDDY SINGING. The MUSIC SLOWED  DOWN with the action, emphasizing Buddy's lack of energy. Sweat dripping off Buddy's forehead, splattering into tin jewels against his microphone. Buddy's tired eyes. dialogues.text: Bernie casts his eyes to the mound of spilled salt in fro of him. Nods. A few beats later he raises his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone. A WAITRESS appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get you another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) I think you better bring me the  bottle. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once again, we see Bernie's feet limp across the casino f He walks up to the bar, asks for a cup of coffee. Doris brings it over. Short on the cream again. He just sips it black. Gloom and doom features. Life suck His master's VOICE sounds over the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang, party of fifteen, your table  is ready, Chang party of fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie looks to Doris. Sighs. Only three more days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the crap tables, the sound of raucous CHEERI becomes audible. A large crowd starting to gather. Bernie noodles his way to the front of the crowd. As soon he gets a look at the heavy hitter at the table, he tense up. Oh shit. It's MIKEY. With Charlene. Charlene is making one hell of racket. Playing up her extremely maternal state. Just then Natalie sidles up to Bernie with the Chivas Reg Without thinking about it, he grabs the glass off the tra downs it in a single gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching her tummy) Come on, Mikey. This is our future.  Don't blow it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey throws down a bet for the dealer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this on the line for the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stickman thanks him as they place the bet. Mikey thro down more money. We can see Mikey has bets all over the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With shoes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dealer's got shoes. Hands high, the  dice are out! The point is nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on all you's. Put a good thought  in for our baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As everyone dotes over Charlene, Mikey quickly swaps the  dice before anyone can see. He throws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six the hard way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey is paid nine thousand by the croupier, as is Charle Bernie stands frozen. He doesn't bother trying to get any closer to the table. He knows it'll do no good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I just felt him kick! He  knows. He knows you're all pulling  for him. God bless you all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie looks over at Charlene. Their eyes meet for a sec It's as though Natalie knows it's a scam and Charlene's  acknowledging it. Mikey throws again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six the hard way! Look out, we got a  shooter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another nine grand. Mikey's rail is nearly full. Charlene hops around awkwardly causing more distraction. Bernie is really sweating it out now. Then Shelly arrives Larry is hot on his tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighteen thousand since I stepped  up. I'm sorry, Shelly, I guess I've  been hit and miss lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly's expression tells us he isn't so sure. Something  definitely isn't kosher. As Charlene chatters on, Mikey switches the dice back. Shelly makes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Fucking amateurs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey throws...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven out! Line away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The players and crowd, though disappointed, applaud Mikey achievement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bowing) I thank you. My wife thanks you. My  unborn child thanks you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey moves his rail of chips to the felt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Color me up will ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry notices Shelly slipping on a pair of leather gloves

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gotta be kidding me. (off Shelly's steely  glare) That's not how I propose we handle  it. We'll turn the matter over to  the authorities. They'll be  blacklisted, their credit ruined...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gets in Larry's face) And then we'll give 'em both a  lollipop for the ride home. Come  watch and learn, Harvard. A little  lesson on how to protect your  investment -- the old school way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly walks over to Mikey and Charlene, Larry lingering  behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that was some run you had back  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks. Just lucky I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mikey steals a tense glance at Charlene. She starts to fi nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we go do this in my office?  I don't like to hand out all this  amount of cash on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security (Tony and Lou) corrals the couple. Leads them aw Bernie watches as they pass by. Mikey looks into Bernie's eyes. They both know he's been made. Natalie doesn't say  anything, just looks at Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slot machines everywhere -- some on the way out, some on way in. Crates of casino supplies. Bernie rushes in with Natalie behind him. Heading for an  aural beacon of BLOWS landing on flesh... GRUNTING,  PLEADING... ...arriving to find Tony and Lou kicking the shit out of  Mikey on the floor. Charlene lies clutching her belly a f feet away. Shelly swings a baseball bat, warming up for s blood sport. Larry watches from the sidelines -- at once  appalled and enthralled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... I can feel the  contractions coming on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie rushes over to Shelly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly, stop them! Don't do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get lost, Bernie, this got nothing  to do with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got everything to do with me.  He's my son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops dead. Freeze frame. Shelly gets a weird lo in his eye. A fuse has just been lit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, he's my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? This little prick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly smashes Mikey across the shoulder with the bat. AARRRGGGGHHH!!! Shelly raises the bat to cream Mikey agai Bernie grabs Shelly's arm. Shelly shoves him back. Raises the bat again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop, help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly, don't you fucking do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly freezes. He lowers the bat, throws it aside. Grabs Bernie by his collar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you in on this? Jesus, you better  come clean with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! God, no! I didn't know nothing  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly releases Bernie. There's a strange look in Shelly' eye. We see the wheels turning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you think their lives are  worth, Bernie? Myself, I don't think  they're worth piss. But, hey, it  ain't my kid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie sees where Shelly's going with this. We can almost hear the cell door slamming in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see: they were up almost a  hundred and fifty grand. That's 150  G's someone's gonna have to account  for. What do you say, Bernie, seventy- five grand a piece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie glances over at Natalie. She has tears in her eyes He looks to Shelly pleadingly. Please don't do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I know you don't have that kind  of cash. But, since you're a friend  of the house, I'm willing to front  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly, they didn't get away with  the money... You didn't lose  anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly glances over at Lou, nods. Lou kicks Mikey in the  face. His nose snaps like a twig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus... Yes! All right. It's on  me. 150 G's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlene clutches her belly, moans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, oh god... you gotta get me  to the hospital... contractions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly, please help her. That's my  grandson...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, why don't we all break out the  champagne? Lootz is about to become  a granddaddy. (walks over to her) How you doin' there, sweetheart?  Must hurt like crap, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods) Hurts so bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Shelly kicks Charlene in the belly! WHAM! She  screeches out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus NOOOOO!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even Shelly's goons can't believe what they've just witne Larry is aghast. Bernie rushes Shelly, starts raining blo on him. Shelly swats him off. He drops down next to the  squirming girl, rips her sweater and blouse up over her  stomach... ...to reveal a mound of fake padding. He tears the paddin away from her, throws it at Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here! It's a fuckin' boy. Anyone got  a cigar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muscle start laughing it up. Relief. Larry emits a ne giggle. Natalie's jaw hits the floor. Bernie takes a step back. He's about to go into serious shock. Charlene curls over, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bernie) You sure you still want to be good  for it? Because if you want to change  your mind, I don't blame you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie looks over at Mikey. He stares up at his father,  trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it up to you, Pop, I  swear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie holds his son's gaze for a beat. He's almost tempt to... He just shrugs and nods at Shelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) That's the worst fucking call you  ever made in your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NATALIE at that moment. We can tell she agrees with  Shelly... but thinks all the more of Bernie for it. That  might even be love in her eyes. Shelly snatches his baseball bat up off the floor. Walks  over to Mikey, and brings it down full force, pulverizing Mikey's left kneecap. Oh man, the scream...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! I thought we  had --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150 G's buys their lives. This is  just a little slap on the wrist to  remember me by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie turns her head. She's about to throw up. Larry  watches, unflinchingly. Charlene is making with some seri pleading now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god... it wasn't my idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly steps up to Charlene, tapping the base of the bat the palm of his hand. He smiles reassuringly at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, motherhood is a beautiful  thing. This... you made a mockery  out of it. Maybe you'll get to  experience it for real one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods, sobbing) I want... to be a mother... please  don't hurt me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly turns his back on her. Charlene starts sobbing rel They're not going to hurt her. It's going to be all right Wrong. Shelly throws the bat to Lou. The heavy steps up t the plate (as we RACK FOCUS to Shelly walking away) --  CRUNCH!!! followed by the girl's SHRIEKS. Natalie buries head in Bernie's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tony and Lou) Get 'em outta here. You ever see  them in this joint again, kill 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bernie and Natalie) You two, you're still on shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly catches Larry's eye: I hope you were taking notes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie's seated on the edge of his bed, drowning his sorr with a bottle of gin. Moonlight paints him in jail bars o shadow. Natalie lingers in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did this to myself. I planted the  seed. When Angela took off with Mikey,  I didn't... I never made an effort  to get back in his life. I figured,  the kid don't need a loser for a  father. Now it's all come full circle.  I give him the money, I open the  door to all this... I musta had it  coming. Payback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie's hand lowers the needle onto the Sinatra record. "Nice 'n' Easy" starts up. She walks over to Bernie, takes the bottle away. Helps hi to his feet. He gives himself over to her reassuring embrace. Natalie  raises Bernie's face to her's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie, it's a big world out there.  If you just took off -- if we took  off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie shakes his head. It's too late for that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie staring up at the ceiling, Bernie nuzzled against her. Her features appear softer than ever. Luminous in th moonlight. Realization moist in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You awake, Bernie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grunts something inaudible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I -- think I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie tenses up. Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't think. I'm pretty certain  of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie raises his head, not quite sure he heard her right Natalie sits up, hugs her knees. Bernie finds himself sta at her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You blind-sided me, Bernie Lootz. I  never saw this coming. You shouldn't  do that to a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie reaches out, caresses her back. She emits a shiver

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still things you don't know...  should know... I don't want to ruin  it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie pulls Natalie back toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't make any difference, Natalie.  Whatever you come clean about, I'm  not gonna feel any different about  you. I'd say the words, but with my  luck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say 'em anyway. To hell with rotten  luck. That's overs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) I love you, Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie smothers her lips against Bernie's. He enshrouds in his arms. Fade out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade into SOFT FOCUS. Slowing taking form... A CAT'S FACE seen in extreme close-up. WIDER -- to reveal the cat resting on Bernie's chest. She MEOWS as he stirs awake. He's stunned to see her there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trixie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cat jumps off his chest and slinks over to her empty  food bowl. Meows again. Bernie breaks into a wide smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trix. You came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie shields his eyes from the bright sunlight streamin in through the blinds. Huh? This is a first for him. He's never gotten direct sunlight in his room before. What's t deal? Did the world just turn on its axis? He glances over his shoulder... No Natalie. Just her  impression in the sheets. And a note on her pillow. For a moment his heart stops. He conjures up the worst. Grabs u the note, unfolds it. We see a lipstick kiss and the words: HAVE A SPECTACULAR

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Bernie lets out a joyful whoop! Leaps out of bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE-UP: Trixie eating some tuna out of her bowl. We hea the record player needle drop on "Luck Be A Lady." Cut to Bernie's feet gliding around the room... PAN UP to Bernie dancing with himself. He's positively aglow. He snatches a salt shaker and sings along with Sinatra. It's true --  love makes the world go around. It obviously also gives l to dead plants, as evidenced by the small bulb that has s up overnight above his radiator. But we won't dwell on th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie struts into the casino a changed man (still to the tune of "Luck Be a Lady"). Even his limp seems less prono as he greets fellow workers as they pass. He catches a glimpse of himself in a wall mirror. Maybe f the first time, he likes what he sees. In the reflection notices Natalie smiling at him. He meets her eyes. She av them quickly, keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly watches Bernie from the video monitor. He appears  less than delighted over Bernie's sunny disposition. He p up the phone, dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Yeah, it's me. Get Bernie over to  crap table six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Per usual, Bernie walks up to the bar, asks for a cup of  coffee. Doris slides it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking around) Got any cre --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he can answer, Doris hands him a container of crea A full container. Taken aback, he starts pouring it into cup, when he hears a VOICE over the intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lovett, party of six, your table is  ready, Lovett, party of six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie looks to Doris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duty calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A -- Bernie arrives at a hundred dollar blackjack table j in time for the dealer to bust out. The crowd goes crazy! B -- Bernie takes a break by leaning up against the side a slot machine. Suddenly, the woman playing it hits a jac C -- Everywhere he seems to go, people continue to win. D -- Bernie, despite the spooky irony, can't help but smi as mountains of chips pile up on the tables. Shelly appea behind him. Not a happy camper. He gestures Bernie to fol him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head over to a section of slots. As they pass one of those huge million dollar slots, the FLOOR MANAGER cuts i front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Shelly, check it out. The new  Mega-Million. I call her Marnie,  'cause she's one frigid broad. Sure,  once in a while she'll flash you a  bit of tit, but your chances of  hitting a home run -- one in twenty  million. Here, give her a shot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Shelly a cup of quarters, takes off. Shelly look to Bernie. He's trying to keep a lid on his anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feeding Marnie  quarters) You wanna tell me what's going on  out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly pulls the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie immediately spits out a small jackpot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reacts with surprise) What do you mean, you don't know?  We're down almost a mil out there.  Doesn't seem strange to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Guess I'm having an off day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have off days, Lootz. You're  shitty luck incarnate. What's wrong?  You coming down with something? You've  got this look about you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly starts feeding Marnie again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's wrong. Fact is, I've never  felt better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She loves me, Shelly. She told me  last night. Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the mention of Natalie's name, we hear a shrieking SIR followed by a deafening toll of slot bells. Shelly's just landed the million dollar jackpot. Shelly stares at the s in surprise -- then looks over at Bernie. Realization hit hard. Fuck! The floor manager staggers over. His expressi is priceless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus... you popped her  cherries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEVERAL CASINO WORKERS have gathered to witness the  deflowering of Marnie. They gaze reverently upon her, as witnessing the "Close Encounters" mothership for the firs time. Shelly drags Bernie out of earshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie? She told you, she loves  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie nods, a huge grin wrenching his cheeks apart. He's about to go helium on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie's serving drinks to a table of high rollers, when Tony and Lou appear behind her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to Shelly's office slams behind Natalie. Shelly  glares at her from behind his desk. We see him thumbing h steel abacus. The beads drifting toward the center. Natal shakily lights up a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put that fucking thing out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie, startled, drops her cigarettes. She kneels to ga them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be. You've gone and fucked  it up big time. I paid you to be his  cooze companion, not his fucking  true love. But, no, you had to go  and get all profound on the poor  schmuck. (mimics female voice) "I love you, Bernie." You know what  you've gone and done, sweetheart?  Those four little words of endearment  have already cost this casino a  million and counting today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumps to his feet) Lady luck. You never heard'a lady  luck?! That's what's goin' on out  there. Lootz is Kryptonite on a stick.  He should have 'em throwing ice cubes  out there, but instead I got a fuckin'  meltdown on my hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly walks around his desk to Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, here's what's gonna happen. You're  outta his life by the time he gets  home. Don't even tell him to his  face, just leave a note. I'll make  some calls, situate you at another  joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (right in her face) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't an act. I meant it. I love  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (close to losing it) What's there to fuckin' love? He's a  loser. Always has been, always will  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were his friend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought you were a smart cookie  when I picked you out. You do not  want to fuck me over, darlin'. I'll  see to it that your next John's a  rattlesnake out in the desert. Now  get the fuck outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie rushes from the office in tears. Shelly closes hi eyes for a moment -- gotta keep it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie approaches some cocktail waitresses about to go of duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Any of you seen Natalie around?  I'm supposed to give her a ride home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think she left already. She wasn't  feelin' too good. We been covering  for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Bernie's expression: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie's Buick pulls into the lot. He parks, heads for hi room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie enters. Flips on the light. No Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calls to the bathroom) Natalie? You in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. He heads over. Finds it empty. Concern spreads across his features. He glances around the room. Notices closet wide open. Natalie's clothes missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Natalie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when he catches sight of the note taped to the dre mirror. He rushes over, rips it off.

dialogues.speaker: US. TAKE CARE, NATALIE.
dialogues.text: Bernie slumps to the floor in disbelief. Starts to trembl Then rocks back and forth, wracked by stifled sobs. Chris make it stop hurting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie seated at the foot of the bed, drinking bourbon fr a solitary glass. He's almost gone through an entire bott He glances down, notices a pair of Natalie's stockings  sticking out from under the bed. He brings them up to his face. Breathes her in, only to exhale a sorry breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie stops at the bar for a cup of coffee. Doris starts pour the cream... whoops... empty. Bernie shrugs. Par for the course. Time to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Bernie back in top form. Forget Mr. Cool, he's tur into Mr. Freeze with a vengeance. The high rollers are fa a nuclear winter on the floor thanks to Bernie.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES
dialogues.text: A -- A man with a fresh bankroll sits at a card table ful of hubris. Bernie pulls up a chair next to him. B -- We see a crowd of players hovering over a busy craps table. The cheerful congregation turns sour as the dice a flung. Players groan as they jettison the table, leaving  just Bernie... C -- We see a dealer pull a six card twenty one as player sit with twelves and thirteens. They sit stunned as their money is swept away. The same man with the hefty bankroll unclips the last of his green. He throws it over to the d to change in. D -- Larry, roaming the floor, is visibly disturbed by  Bernie's cooling ability. It's something he can't quantif and it unsettles him. He glances up toward Shelly's  observation window, knows the man is gloating. Good call. dialogues.text: Shelly suddenly jabs Larry in the throat with the tips of his fingers. Larry gasps, starts to cave. Shelly keeps hi upright, escorts him to a nearby men's room. Nicky and Ma looking on in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door flies open, Larry catapults into frame. OOF! Bounces off the wall. Shelly's right behind him. He drags Larry to his feet. Slams him into the wall again -- gets  right up in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you listen real good, you Harvard  turd. Lootz is on the up-and-up. He  leaves here tonight with whatever he  comes out with. You so much as touch  a hair on his head and I'll fucking  wallpaper this joint with your ass.  Muted tones, right? (slams him hard) What's that? I don't hear nothing.  Wait a minute -- yeah, now I hear  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blended in at a subsonic level. Some kinda mantra: pain, pain, pain. Shelly headbutts Larry. It's like the sound of a walnut  cracking. Larry slumps to the floor. Shelly takes a deep  breath. Control, control, control. He heads over to the s washes his hands -- over and over. Larry moaning in the b Shelly adjusts his tie in the mirror. Control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly exits the men's room, makes his way back to the cr table where Bernie is. Just in time to see Bernie lay twe five grand on the pass line. A waitress hands a drink off Bernie. He takes a healthy swig. Then picks up the dice. Throws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crap ace deuce! Line down!

dialogues.text: The crowd gasps in horror as Bernie's twenty five grand i quickly raked in. He replaces it with another stack of ch The dice are pushed over to him. He rubs the felt real ge before throwing. Then lets loose the dice. All eyes follow the dice. They hit the felt and bounce ar behind a stack of chips. The stickman can't spot them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it.

dialogues.text: A croupier makes the call as anxious players rubberneck t get a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd groans again. It appears the streak is over. Bernie looks out over the felt. This is his moment of tru He unloads his entire rail and puts it on the field. He yells out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty thousand dollars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd chimes in with every opinion under the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the field? What're you fucking  nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake it, don't break it, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dice are slowly pushed over to Bernie. The crowd is  feeling it. The entire casino is feeling it. Bernie lets a long soulful sigh. His whole life depends on the next t and everyone knows it. Bernie rubs the felt as usual and lines up the dice to sh a six and a six. He picks them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on sixty-six!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locks eyes with Shelly -- then lets loose. The dice fly f his hand. Slowly, ever so slowly we watch them sail acros the table. The entire table holds their breath in  anticipation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie throws open the doors, stumbles out. His limp seem more pronounced. He wears a miserable expression. At the car Bernie steps up. Opens the door, slides in beh the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natalie throws her arms around him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God... I thought for sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie just looks at her. Pale, mournful features.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, right? You guys worked it  out. He took the three grand? Tell  me it's okay, Bernie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't answer. Just starts up the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the surveillance monitors: the epidemic continues --  players winning at every table. The Shangri-la's been wip out. There's no way they can cover this amount of winning action. PANNING ACROSS to Shelly. Defeated. The phone rings  incessantly in the b.g. Shelly ignores it. Lou pokes his head into the office:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to get that, Shelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly doesn't respond. He reaches into his desk drawer f that bottle and a glass. Is about to pour himself a shot. Fuck it. Pushes the glass aside. Takes it straight from t bottle. The phone keeps ringing... On the scale model of the newly proposed Shangri-la. Hold it. WHAM! A chair enters frame, shatters "paradise." WIDER: Shelly trashing the model with a vengeance. Kickin the debris around the office. Drenched in sweat, Shelly staggers over to his desk. Swat the empty gin bottle to the floor. Picks up his disinfect spray, gives his desk one last wipedown. Immaculate. Stands, walks out...

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: We see the lights of the city receding in Bernie's rearvi mirror. Once outside of the city limits Bernie pulls the over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you stopping for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie throws open his door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm gonna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw up. And he does. It's as if he's choking up the ent city. Everything that's bad about it. Finally, he pulls  himself back into the car. Slams the door. Natalie touches his cheek, a reassuring look in her eyes. Suddenly, he's smiling. He opens his coat and a huge wad cash tumbles out. He throws it up into the air. Natalie a chokes with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bahamas, here we come, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws her arms around him... Suddenly an EXPLOSION OF LIGHT! A flashlight. In the hand a MOTORCYCLE COP. He raps on the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step out of the car please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lowers the window) What's the problem, officer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop runs the flashlight over the bundles of cash litt the car interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just step out of the car, please.  Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie and Natalie exchange unsettled looks. The cop lowe his hand to his gun. Bernie nods at Natalie. They climb o He directs them off to the side. Shines his light in thei faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If my driving... if I was going a  little fast -- I was just over  excited, officer. See, we just had a big win at the Shangri-la --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't win nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop pulls out his revolver, trains it on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly opens the door to his Cadillac. Climbs behind the  wheel. His keys are already waiting in the ignition. Who' gonna steal Shelly Kaplow's car, right? Shelly doesn't start her up. He just leans back in his se emits a deep sigh. He glances up at the rearview mirror. Catches sight of a SILHOUETTE in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie and Natalie staring into the barrel of the cop's  revolver. Natalie clutches Bernie's arm. Bernie nods. So  there you have it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, Bernie, I knew it. It was  too good to be true. Who were we  kidding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get down on your knees. Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at him in shock. He gestures them to the ground behind Bernie's car. We CUT TO a shot from the highway: j the cop standing at the tail-end of Bernie's car, Natalie and Bernie hidden from view.

dialogues.speaker: ON BERNIE AND NATALIE
dialogues.text: down on their knees. Bernie places his arm around Natalie pulls her close to him. Paralyzed with terror, she still  manages a bittersweet smile. Bernie should be projecting fear, but there's nothing but his overwhelming love for Natalie in his eyes. It's a two way current. This is their last moment together; everything that needs be said is being transmitted through a look. A look that  says: no regrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky leans forward out of the shadows. Shelly holds his  gaze in the mirror. Nicky just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid wants you should know, Shelly,  he's just protecting our investment --  the old school way. See you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly nods. He knows the score... A flash of steel appea against his head. Muzzle strobe -- THUP! So long, Shelly  Kaplow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop looms over Bernie and Natalie. Cocks his pistol. Lowers the gun to the back of Bernie's head. They appear oblivious to it. They're already in another p Sunning themselves in the Bahamas. The cop squeezes back the trigger.

dialogues.speaker: ON BERNIE AND NATALIE
dialogues.text: still looking at each other. Suddenly the piercing shriek SCREECHING TIRES... followed by a reverberating, bone  crunching -- WHAM! -- and a GUNSHOT. Bernie and Natalie still staring into each other's eyes, quite sure what's just transpired. Only that they're stil breathing. They look around, startled to see the tail lig of a PICK-UP TRUCK about ten yards away. The cop, their w be assassin, rendered road kill beneath the wheels. All this in the blink of an eye. Natalie clutches Bernie's arm. Suppresses a hysterical, s induced giggle. Bernie just looks dumbfounded. He stagger to his feet, rushes over to the pick-up truck. The driver head is protruding through the shattered windshield. Death-glazed eyes. Bernie feels for the man's pulse just to be sure. Shakes head. We see a dozen Coors empties on the seat and floor the truck. Natalie checks the cop. Likewise. Bernie comes over. They regard each other breathlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was drunk. It was just freak  luck... (catches himself...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't give it a name, Bernie. It  scares me. All I know is, you're  still running hot and that's a good  thing. But we're only winners if we  keep going. No looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady luck, Natalie. I'm calling it.  Lady luck. And we got it as long as  we're together. They can't touch us  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her furiously. Then drags her over to his car. They climb in. Drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie's Buick racing into the sunrise. Racing toward the dream. Bernie, eyes fixed on the road ahead, with the  contented smile of a man who has gambled on love -- and w His prize, resting her head against his shoulder. The money, well, that ain't half bad as well. A smoky, tr driven Chet Baker-like piece accentuates the triumphant m on the soundtrack, as we SUPERIMPOSE...

dialogues.text: ...a little flash-forward into the future. Larry sits wit group of CORPORATE TYPES.

dialogues.text: Gentlemen... (beat) I thank you for your vote of  confidence. As the Shangri-la's new  Director of Casino Operations, I'm  gonna make a personal guarantee to  each and every one of you. Your  investment in this casino will be  well looked after. The future looks  bright, gentlemen. Very, very bright.

dialogues.text: They raise their glasses to him. Congenial smiles, one an all. Smiles that don't transcend to their eyes. Promises, promises. We'll see... DISSOLVING BACK INTO...
